name: interposition
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of putting something between two things, people, or groups, or into the middle of something: the interposition of a U.N. peacekeeping force The interposition of this word completely changes the meaning of the phrase.
the act of getting involved in a situation in order to influence it: He obtained the post through the interposition of a friend. They believed these were the interpositions of the devil. See
interpose
More examplesFewer examplesThe operation involved the interposition of a vein graft between two arteries.They believed this could not have happened without the interposition of Divine Providence.the unwarranted interposition of the authorities
